metadata.title: CVE-2016-1947 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Mozilla Firefox 43.x mishandles attempts to connect to the ApplicationReputation service, which makes it easier for remote attackers to triggeran unintended download by leveraging the absence of reputation data.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-1947` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 44.0+build3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 44.0+build3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 44.0+build3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 44.0+build3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '44.0+build3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
